triageFlags.title: Sub-prime Credit Score
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score falls into the sub-prime category, below the minimum for standard terms.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider stricter lending criteria or additional security measures.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, a credit score below 620 requires stricter lending criteria, as it indicates a higher risk of default.

triageFlags.title: Vehicle Age Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The vehicle's age at the start of the agreement exceeds the maximum allowed by policy.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the proposal or consider a different vehicle that meets the age criteria.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum vehicle age of 8 years (96 months) at the start of the agreement to ensure asset value retention.

triageFlags.title: High Loan-to-Value Ratio
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio is high, approaching the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Ensure the LTV does not exceed the policy limit and consider additional deposit requirements.
triageFlags.reasoning: High LTV ratios increase the lender's risk exposure, particularly for sub-prime applicants.

content.reasoning: The identified issues, such as the sub-prime credit score and vehicle age, indicate a higher risk profile. However, the applicant's stable income and low credit utilization provide some mitigating factors.
